interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
Review Date: 2013/03/01
Store: Ray Romano  (Actor),     Denis Leary  (Actor),     Steve Martino  (Director),     Mike Thurmeier  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, All Fox Titles
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Historys greatest heroes return for the most outrageously funny and entertaining Ice Age adventure in two million years. When Scrats acorn antics cause a cataclysmic crack-up, Manny (Ray Romano), Sid (John Leguizamo) and Diego (Denis Leary) go where no herd has gone before on a high-seas quest aboard a floating iceberg. But a menagerie of misfit pirates are determined to shiver their timbers and capsize their journey home. Join a boat-load of lovable new characters (voiced by Jennifer Lopez, Aziz Ansari and Peter Dinklage) for original songs, spectacular animation and heartwarming family fun.', 'Amazon.com', 'The revisionist version of natural history offered up in the', 'Ice Age', 'movies gets yet another twist in the fourth installment, 10 years after Manny the woolly mammoth, Diego the saber-toothed tiger, Sid the sloth, and Scrat the squirrel made their chilly debut to hot box-office receipts. The lessons of family and loyalty in', 'Continental Drift', "may seem a little warmed over, but the creatively constructed laughs, amusing voice characterizations, and inventive CGI animation are reason enough to keep the series viable for kids to giggle about and grownups to belly laugh over--sometimes for exactly the same reasons. Once again, acorn-addicted Scrat is the cause of some pretty important behind-the-scenes machinations. His dialogue-free antics also serve as a stand-alone subplot that could easily be a very clever short film of its own. This time the weasely rodent's addled obsession with the fruit of the oak is revealed as the cause of the formation of the world's continents as we now know them. He sets the story--and planet Earth--in motion while pursuing a little nut in a hyperactive prologue that causes underground rifts that in turn form the famous shapes of Australia, Africa, North America, and the outline of Italy (which it turns out is shaped like a boot for a very good reason). Above ground this means more global chaos for the herd of animals we've come to know so well. All the familiar voices reprise their wonderful roles as fissures in earth and ice separate Manny (Ray Romano) from his woolly wife Ellie (Queen Latifah) and boy-crazy teenager Peaches (Keke Palmer). With a killer continental shelf bearing down on them, mother and daughter lead the madcap pack of animal characters toward a safe meeting place while Manny, Diego (Denis Leary), Sid (John Leguizamo), and Sid's crazy granny (Wanda Sykes) drift away on an iceberg schooner into a newly vast open ocean. While floating into oblivion, the mismatched pack encounters a band of animal pirates piloting another slab of ship-shaped ice, captained by a crazed baboon named Gutt (Peter Dinklage), who's bent on resentment-based revenge. The motley crew provides a plethora of comic encounters and a new raft of excellent voice actors. Running a close second to Dinklage in ingenious casting is Jennifer Lopez as Shira, a sultry tiger who, don't cha know, ends up on the good ship and falling for Diego in the end. The adventures of both the land- and sea-based creatures are full of clever gags and densely constructed set pieces that may not be quite up to Pixar story standards, but are certainly always on the ball and executed with computer-animation acumen that is astonishingly lifelike for such an unreal-looking world. Scrat's misadventures act as interstitial connectors to the parallel heroes' journey stories until they ultimately intersect in a massively scaled finale. Even after all the melting and refreezing, the", 'Ice Age', 'world is still a hot commodity in the animated-franchise business and remains a good investment despite the constancy of global rifts in entertaining family fare.', '--Ted Fry']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'FOXS2280028DVD', 'Director': 'Steve Martino, Mike Thurmeier', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Animated, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 28 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 11, 2012', 'Actors': 'Ray Romano, Denis Leary', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, English', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Why did this do another version of this movie? It's all the same. This version was just more violent and when you thought it could have a really nice ending, they robbed us of that too. Hint, tiger have a mate. Ug.
Review Title: Same movie, again
Rating: 3.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Frankenweenie
Martin Short  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Tim Burton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, All Disney Titles
['Product Description', 'From Disney and creative genius Tim Burton (ALICE IN WONDERLAND; THE NIGHTMARE BEFORE CHRISTMAS) comes the hilarious and offbeat FRANKENWEENIE, a heartwarming tale about a boy and his dog. After unexpectedly losing his beloved dog Sparky, young Victor harnesses the power of science to bring his best friend back to life -- with just a few minor adjustments. He tries to hide his home-sewn creation, but when Sparky gets out, Victor\'s fellow students, teachers and the entire town learn that getting a new "leash on life" can be monstrous. Complete with electrifying bonus features, FRANKENWEENIE is alive with enchanting fun for the whole family.', 'Brand Story', 'By']
{'Genre': 'Animation', 'Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Contributor': "Charlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona RyderCharlie Tahan, Robert Capron, Martin Short, Tim Burton, Martin Landau, Atticus Shaffer, Catherine O'Hara, Winona Ryder  See more", 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Digital 5.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR786936814149#VG', 'Director': 'Tim Burton', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Animated, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen, Dubbed, Enhanced', 'Run time': '1 hour and 27 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 8, 2013', 'Actors': "Martin Short, Catherine O'Hara, Martin Landau, Winona Ryder, Robert Capron", 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': 'WALT DISNEY PICTURES', 'Number of discs': '1'}
If you do not "get" Tim Burton, this movie may not thrill you, but the art is incredible. You have to consider the pain-stacking stop-motion work despite the odd story-line. This is art at its best. I was only sad that he didn't work with Johny Depp on this one.
You have to love Tim Burton!
Arthur Christmas
Sarah Smith  (Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Product Description', 'How CAN Santa deliver billions of presents to the whole world in just one night? With an army of one million combat-style Field Elves and a vast, state-of-the-art control center under the ice of the North Pole! So how could this incredible operation have MISSED one child?! To Santa’s young son, Arthur, it threatens to end the magic of Christmas. With retired Grandsanta, a rebellious young elf, an old sleigh and some untrained reindeer, Arthur sets out in a crazy mission to deliver the last present! Deck the halls with excitement, fun and wonder in this new Christmas classic!', 'Amazon.com']
{'Genre': 'Family, Animation, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Sarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla ShelleySarah Smith, David Sproxton, Aardman Animations; Columbia Pictures; Sony Pictures Animation Inc., Peter Lord, Steve Pegram, Carla Shelley   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Stereo)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Digital Copy Expiration Date': 'December 31, 2017', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '40952', 'Director': 'Sarah Smith', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 37 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 6, 2012', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Producers': 'Peter Lord, David Sproxton, Carla Shelley, Steve Pegram', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Seller was great, but this tale of Christmas was awful in many ways. If you don't want a spoiler, don't read, but Christmas now comes from an "alien" sort of ship delivered by thousands of odd looking elves and Santa is just "in charge" - an old sort of "out of it" guy. It is not a classic I will want to watch again. There were terrible moments that made me want to cry. How is that a happy Christmas?
A really bizarre way to represent Christmas

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Favorite Genre**: Animation, with a strong affinity for unique and offbeat storytelling, especially within family-friendly content.

- **Preferred Directors**: Deep admiration for distinctive directors like Tim Burton, valuing their artistic styles and innovative storytelling approaches.

- **Artistic Appreciation**: Holds animation in high regard as a vibrant art form, particularly enjoying the intricacies of stop-motion techniques and imaginative visual aesthetics.

- **Emotional Depth**: Enjoys narratives that effectively blend heartwarming themes with unusual or darker elements. However, the user has shown a more critical stance toward certain portrayals that stray from traditional values in recent interactions.

- **Review Engagement**: Actively provides detailed feedback on media, highlighting artistic merit and personal feelings, particularly expressing disappointment when themes do not resonate with cherished values.

- **Value in Collaborations**: Interested in collaborative works among talented actors and directors, seeking unique creative partnerships within animation.

- **Recent Critical Insights**: Recent purchases reflect a growing scrutiny of animated works that, despite being imaginative, may replicate familiar formulas or incorporate excessive violence, detracting from emotional fulfillment. The user desires creativity that aligns with a satisfying resolution, emphasizing quality and depth over mere entertainment.
